title: ggblanket
text: ggblanket package wrapper functions around fantastic ggplot2 package. primary objective simplify ggplot2 visualisation. Secondary objectives relate : Scope: cover useful 80% ggplot2 Design: produce well-designed visualisation default Alignment: use conventions generally aligned ggplot2. intended useful levels experience beginner expert.
code: library(ggblanket) library(ggplot2) library(dplyr) library(stringr) library(palmerpenguins)

title: ggblanket
text: simplify ggplot2 visualisation, ggblanket package provides: gg_* wrapper functions plot single geom col fill aesthetics merged single col argument facet argument effortlessly facet additional facet2 argument facet second variable pal argument customise colours Prefixed arguments customise scales, guides, titles facetting Default titles converted snakecase::to_sentence Numeric limits default max/min break Horizontal plots nicely arranged Colours generally inherit subsequent geoms Access geom_* arguments via ... theme argument customisation gg_theme function create quick theme way easily create customised plot functions Control plotly::ggplotly tooltips add_tooltip_text

what: 1. gg_* wrapper functions to plot a single geom
title: ggblanket
text: gg_*functions wrap ggplot2 ggplot(aes(...)) function applicable ggplot2 geom_*() function. aesthetics (text) within ggplot function, therefore inherit subsequent geom’s added default. Always pipe data, can access variable names Rstudio autocomplete.
code: iris |>   mutate(Species = str_to_sentence(Species)) |>    gg_point(     x = Sepal.Width,      y = Sepal.Length,      col = Species)

what: 2. col and fill aesthetics merged into a single col argument
title: ggblanket
text: fill concept ggblanket. Instead, col relates col fill concepts ggplot2.
code: penguins |>    gg_histogram(     x = body_mass_g,      col = species)

what: 3. A facet argument to effortlessly facet
title: ggblanket
text: Facetting treated aesthetic, users just provide unquoted variable facet . single facet (facet2) variable provided, ’ll default “wrap” layout. can change facet_layout = "grid" argument.
code: penguins |>    tidyr::drop_na(sex) |>   mutate(sex = str_to_sentence(sex)) |>   gg_violin(     x = sex,      y = body_mass_g,      facet = species)

what: 4. An additional facet2 argument to facet by a second variable
title: ggblanket
text: Faceting two variables often useful. facetand facet2 variables provided, gg_* function default “grid” layout facet facet2. can change facet_layout = "wrap" argument.
code: penguins |>   tidyr::drop_na(sex) |>   mutate(sex = str_to_sentence(sex)) |>    gg_density(     x = flipper_length_mm,     col = sex,     facet = species,     facet2 = island   )

what: 5. A pal argument to customise colours
title: ggblanket
text: pal argument allows users pick vector colours want. arguments work way regardless whether col variable specified .
code: penguins |>    mutate(sex = str_to_sentence(sex)) |>    group_by(species, sex) |>    summarise(body_mass_g = mean(body_mass_g, na.rm = TRUE)) |>    gg_col(     x = species,      y = body_mass_g,      col = sex,      position = position_dodge2(preserve = "single"),     pal = c("#1B9E77", "#9E361B"))

what: 6. Prefixed arguments to customise scales, guides, titles and facetting
title: ggblanket
text: prefixed arguments designed work Rstudio autocomplete help remember find adjustment need. Determine whether want change relates x,y, col facet, type prefix press tab key access list autocomplete. use arrow keys, press tab select. Available arguments : *_breaks: Adjust breaks axis *_expand: Adjust padding beyond limits *_include: Include value within scale *_labels: Adjust labels breaks *_limits: Adjust limits *_trans: Transform axis *_sec_axis: Add secondary axis *_title: Add title col_continuous colour continuous variable (e.g. “steps”) col_rescale: whether rescale pal across continuous col variable col_legend_place: Place put legend (e.g. “r”) col_legend_ncol: Number columns arrange legend elements col_legend_nrow: Number rows arrange legend elements col_legend_rev: Whether reverse legend facet_layout: Whether layout “wrap” “grid” facet_scales: facet scales treated facet_space: Whether facet space allocated proportionally facet_ncol: many columns wrap facets facet_nrow: many rows wrap facets
code: penguins |>   gg_jitter(     x = species,     y = body_mass_g,     col = flipper_length_mm,     col_continuous = "steps",     y_include = 0,     y_breaks = scales::breaks_width(1500),      y_labels = scales::label_number()   )

title: ggblanket
text: make quicker get plot titles good external people see, often work nicely snakecase column names. titles need change manually, can change manually using x_title, y_title, col_title. remove titles, can use x_title = "" within gg_* function equivalent y col titles. add + ggplot2::labs(x = NULL, y = NULL, col = NULL, fill = NULL) layer applicable.
code: penguins |>   group_by(species, sex) |>   summarise(across(body_mass_g, ~ round(mean(.x, na.rm = TRUE)), 0)) |>    gg_tile(     x = sex,      y = species,      col = body_mass_g,      x_labels = snakecase::to_sentence_case,     pal = pals::brewer.blues(9),      width = 0.9,     height = 0.9,     col_legend_place = "r",     title = "Average penguin body mass",     subtitle = "Palmer Archipelago, Antarctica",     theme = gg_theme(grid_h = FALSE,                      bg_plot_pal = "white",                      axis_pal = "white",                       ticks_pal = "white")) +   geom_text(aes(label = body_mass_g), col = "#232323", size = 3.5)

what: 8. Numeric limits that default to the max/min break
title: ggblanket
text: default x y scales designed create symmetry. y numeric, y limits default max y breaks zero y expanding. similar x scale, y character/factor/logical x numeric. revert min/max data, use *_limits = c(NA, NA) *_limits = c(lubridate::NA_Date_, lubridate::NA_Date_).
code: storms |>   group_by(year) |>   filter(between(year, 1980, 2020)) |>   summarise(wind = mean(wind, na.rm = TRUE)) |>   gg_line(     x = year,     y = wind,     x_labels = scales::label_number(big.mark = ""),     y_include = 0,     title = "Storm wind speed",     subtitle = "USA average storm wind speed, 1980\u20132020",     y_title = "Wind speed (knots)",     caption = "Source: NOAA"   ) +   geom_point()

title: ggblanket
text: plots horizontal, ggblanket ensures y labels, colours legends generally right order.
code: penguins |>   tidyr::drop_na(sex) |>    group_by(species, sex, island) |>   summarise(body_mass_kg = mean(body_mass_g) / 1000) |>   gg_col(     x = body_mass_kg,      y = species,      col = sex,      facet = island,     width = 0.75,     col_labels = snakecase::to_sentence_case,      position = "dodge")

what: 10. Colours that generally inherit to subsequent geoms
title: ggblanket
text: pal generally inherited subsequent geom layers regardless whether col argument. ‘hood’, dummy col fill aesmthetic variables added, colour scale added legend turned . approach can cause challenges. discussed ‘Multiple geom layers’ section. Note alpha inherit.
code: penguins %>%   gg_boxplot(x = species,              y = body_mass_g,              width = 0.5,              pal = "#1B9E77",               outlier.colour = NA) +   geom_jitter()

what: 11. Access to other geom_* arguments via ...
title: ggblanket
text: relates arguments mapping argument aesthetics. Common arguments add size, linewidth width. arguments can identified help relevant ggplot2::geom_* function.
code: penguins |>   tidyr::drop_na(sex) |>   gg_smooth(     x = flipper_length_mm,     y = body_mass_g,     col = sex,     size = 0.5,      level = 0.99,      col_legend_place = "t",     col_title = "",      col_labels = snakecase::to_sentence_case   )

title: ggblanket
text: allows utilise simplicity ggblanket, making content required look feel. using theme argument, theme control theme aspects, legend position, direction justification. controlled within gg_* function, legend positions can adjusted easily col_legend_place argument (e.g. `col_legend_place = "r"). prefer theme adjust everything including legend, add theme layer instead (e.g. + theme_grey()). Note use default theme, ggblanket guesses gridlines want based type data provided gg_* function. provide theme, need theme provide gridlines want.
code: penguins |>   mutate(sex = str_to_sentence(sex)) |>    gg_point(x = bill_depth_mm,            y = bill_length_mm,            col = sex,            facet = species,             pal = c("#1B9E77", "#9E361B"),             theme = theme_grey())

what: 13. A gg_theme function to create a quick theme
title: ggblanket
text: gg_theme function allows create theme looks similar ggblanket look feel. includes following arguments adjusting gridlines, background colours, text axis lines ticks. Use grid_h grid_v logical arguments add gridlines. Otherwise function defaults gridlines. void = TRUE argument useful maps.
code: storms |>   group_by(year) |>   filter(between(year, 1980, 2020)) |>   summarise(wind = mean(wind, na.rm = TRUE)) |>   gg_col(     x = year,     y = wind,     x_labels = scales::label_comma(big.mark = ""),     x_expand = c(0, 0),     width = 0.75,     theme = gg_theme(       bg_plot_pal = "white",       bg_panel_pal = "white",       grid_h = TRUE))

what: 14. A way to easily create your own customised plot functions
title: ggblanket
text: ... argument can allow access arguments within ggblanket gg_ function.
code: gg_point_custom <- function(data, x, y, col,                              size = 3,                              pal = pals::brewer.dark2(9),                              col_title = "",                              col_legend_place = "t",                             ...) {   data |>      gg_point(x = {{ x }}, y = {{ y }}, col = {{col}},               size = size,               pal = pal,               col_title = col_title,               col_legend_place = col_legend_place,               ...) }  iris |>   mutate(Species = str_to_sentence(Species)) |>    gg_point_custom(     x = Sepal.Width,     y = Sepal.Length,     col = Species,      title = "Edgar Anderson's iris data",     subtitle = "Iris sepal length by width and species",     caption = "Edgar Anderson, 1935"   )

what: 15. Control over plotly::ggplotly tooltips with add_tooltip_text
title: ggblanket
text: add_tooltip_text function allows users create nice tooltips combination gg_*() text argument, tooltip = "text" argument ggplotly.
code: theme_custom <- gg_theme(   "helvetica",   bg_plot_pal = "white",   bg_panel_pal = "white",   grid_h = TRUE )  iris |>    mutate(Species = str_to_sentence(Species)) |>    add_tooltip_text(titles = snakecase::to_sentence_case) |>    gg_point(     x = Sepal.Width,      y = Sepal.Length,      col = Species,      text = text,      col_legend_place = "r",     theme = theme_custom) |>    plotly::ggplotly(tooltip = "text")

title: ggblanket
text: plots multiple geom’s, need think desired drawing order want, choose gg_* function permits order. plots geoms acol aesthetic , must choose gg_* function relates one layers col argument. , conflicts desired drawing order, choose gg_blank (.e. col argument). reason ggblanket hood creates dummy colour scale col argument. know gg_* function going use, might need use *_include argument adjust x y scale include range needed subsequent layers. subsequent layers require aesthetics gg_* function, use inherit.aes = FALSE argument geom_* function. example, make coloured column graph grey error bars, use gg_col function layer col aesthetic drawing order means underneath errorbars.
code: df <- data.frame(   trt = factor(c(1, 1, 2, 2)),   resp = c(1, 5, 3, 4),   group = factor(c(1, 2, 1, 2)),   upper = c(1.1, 5.3, 3.3, 4.2),   lower = c(0.8, 4.6, 2.4, 3.6) )  df %>%    gg_col(     x = trt,     y = resp,     col = group,     position = "dodge",     y_include = max(df$upper)    ) +   geom_errorbar(     aes(x = trt, ymin = lower, ymax = upper, group = group),     inherit.aes = FALSE,     col = "#7F7F7F",     position = position_dodge(width = 0.9),     width = 0.1     )

title: ggblanket
text: gg_* functions directly support aesthetics alpha, size, linewidth, shape, linetype. However, use gg_blank addition col argument, add title new aesthetic align col_title.  use computed variables. Instead need ggplot2, required.  ggplot2 functionality unsupported ggblanket, add ggplot2 layer ggblanket code. example, using + labs(x = NULL) + facet_grid(..., switch = "y"). Note ggblanket keeps x y --bound values (.e. uses scales::oob_keep hood). However, can zoom using coord = coord_cartesian(xlim = ..., ylim = ...) (filtering data).
code: penguins |>    gg_blank(x = flipper_length_mm, y = body_mass_g, col = species) +   geom_point(aes(shape = species)) +   labs(shape = "Species") diamonds |>    ggplot() +   geom_bin_2d(aes(x = carat, y = price, fill = after_stat(count))) +   gg_theme(grid_h = TRUE) +   scale_fill_gradientn(colours = viridis::viridis(9)) +   scale_y_continuous(expand = c(0, 0),                       breaks = scales::breaks_pretty(5),                       limits = range(scales::breaks_pretty(5)(diamonds$price))) +   labs(x = "Carat", y = "Price", fill = "Count")

title: Add a tooltip text column of united variable names and values. — add_tooltip_text
text: data data frame tibble. ... Arguments passed select (.e unquoted variables, tidyselect helpers etc). arguments provided, uses columns. titles function format variable names, including rlang lambda format.

title: Add a tooltip text column of united variable names and values. — add_tooltip_text
text: data frame tibble column text

title: Add a tooltip text column of united variable names and values. — add_tooltip_text
code:
iris %>% add_tooltip_text() %>% head(1) #> Sepal.Length Sepal.Width Petal.Length Petal.Width Species #> 1 5.1 3.5 1.4 0.2 setosa #> text #> 1 Sepal.Length: 5.1
Sepal.Width: 3.5
Petal.Length: 1.4
Petal.Width: 0.2
Species: setosa iris %>% add_tooltip_text(Species, tidyselect::contains("Sepal")) %>% head(1) #> Sepal.Length Sepal.Width Petal.Length Petal.Width Species #> 1 5.1 3.5 1.4 0.2 setosa #> text #> 1 Species: setosa
Sepal.Length: 5.1
Sepal.Width: 3.5 library(snakecase) iris %>% add_tooltip_text(titles = ~ to_sentence_case(.x)) %>% head(1) #> Sepal.Length Sepal.Width Petal.Length Petal.Width Species #> 1 5.1 3.5 1.4 0.2 setosa #> text #> 1 Sepal length: 5.1
Sepal width: 3.5
Petal length: 1.4
Petal width: 0.2

title: polygon ggplot. — gg_polygon
code: library(ggplot2)  ids <- factor(c("1.1", "2.1", "1.2", "2.2", "1.3", "2.3"))  values <- data.frame(   id = ids,   value = c(3, 3.1, 3.1, 3.2, 3.15, 3.5) )  positions <- data.frame(   id = rep(ids, each = 4),   x = c(2, 1, 1.1, 2.2, 1, 0, 0.3, 1.1, 2.2, 1.1, 1.2, 2.5, 1.1, 0.3,         0.5, 1.2, 2.5, 1.2, 1.3, 2.7, 1.2, 0.5, 0.6, 1.3),   y = c(-0.5, 0, 1, 0.5, 0, 0.5, 1.5, 1, 0.5, 1, 2.1, 1.7, 1, 1.5,         2.2, 2.1, 1.7, 2.1, 3.2, 2.8, 2.1, 2.2, 3.3, 3.2) )  datapoly <- merge(values, positions, by = c("id"))  datapoly %>%   gg_polygon(x = x,              y = y,              col = value,              group = id)   holes <-   do.call(rbind, lapply(split(datapoly, datapoly$id), function(df) {     df$x <- df$x + 0.5 * (mean(df$x) - df$x)     df$y <- df$y + 0.5 * (mean(df$y) - df$y)     df   }))  datapoly$subid <- 1L holes$subid <- 2L datapoly <- rbind(datapoly, holes)  datapoly %>%   gg_polygon(     x = x,     y = y,     col = value,     group = id,     subgroup = subid   )

title: Smooth ggplot. — gg_smooth
code: library(ggplot2)  gg_smooth(mpg, x = displ, y = hwy) #> `geom_smooth()` using method = 'loess' and formula 'y ~ x' #> `geom_smooth()` using method = 'loess' and formula 'y ~ x'   gg_smooth(mpg, x = displ, y = hwy) +   geom_point() #> `geom_smooth()` using method = 'loess' and formula 'y ~ x' #> `geom_smooth()` using method = 'loess' and formula 'y ~ x'   gg_smooth(mpg, x = hwy, y = displ) +   geom_point() #> `geom_smooth()` using method = 'loess' and formula 'y ~ x' #> `geom_smooth()` using method = 'loess' and formula 'y ~ x'   gg_smooth(mpg, x = hwy, y = displ, orientation = "y") +   geom_point() #> `geom_smooth()` using method = 'loess' and formula 'y ~ x' #> `geom_smooth()` using method = 'loess' and formula 'y ~ x'   gg_smooth(mpg, x = displ, y = hwy, method = "lm") +   geom_point() #> `geom_smooth()` using formula 'y ~ x' #> `geom_smooth()` using formula 'y ~ x'

text: family font family text use. Defaults "". title_pal colour palette title family. Defaults "#000000". title_family font family title. NULL, inherits family argument. title_size size title family. Defaults 11. title_face font style title family. Defaults "bold". subtitle_family font family subtitle. NULL, inherits family argument. caption_pal colour palette caption. Defaults "#7F7F7F". caption_size size caption. Defaults 9. caption_face font style caption. Defaults "plain". axis_size size axis. Defaults 0.3. axis_pal colour palette axis. Defaults "#323232". ticks_size size ticks. Defaults 0.3. ticks_pal colour palette ticks. Defaults "#323232". bg_plot_pal colour palette plot background colour. bg_panel_pal colour palette panel background colour. bg_legend_key_pal colour palette legend key. Can also use special values "plot" "panel". grid_h TRUE FALSE whether show hotizontal gridlines. Defaults FALSE. grid_v TRUE FALSE whether show vertical gridlines. Defaults FALSE. grid_pal colour palette vertical major gridlines. Defaults "#D3D3D3". grid_size size vertical major gridlines. Defaults 0.2. facet_gap_size size spacing facet panels units "lines". Defaults snakecase::to_sentence_case. title Title string. subtitle Subtitle string. coord Coordinate system. x_breaks function takes limits input (e.g. scales::breaks_pretty()), vector breaks. x_expand Padding limits ggplot2::expansion function, vector length 2 (e.g. c(0, 0)). x_include numeric date variable, values scale include (e.g. 0). x_labels function takes breaks inputs (e.g. scales::label_comma()), vector labels. x_limits vector length 2 determine limits axis. Alternatively, zoom using coord = coord_cartesian(xlim = ...). x_sec_axis secondary axis specified ggplot2::sec_axis ggplot2::dup_axis function. x_title Axis title string. Defaults converting sentence case spaces. Use "" title. x_trans numeric variable, transformation object (e.g. "log10"). y_breaks function takes limits input (e.g. scales::breaks_pretty()), vector breaks. y_expand Padding limits ggplot2::expansion function, vector length 2 (e.g. c(0, 0)). y_include numeric date variable, values scale include (e.g. 0). y_labels function takes breaks inputs (e.g. scales::label_comma()), vector labels. y_limits vector length 2 determine limits axis. Alternatively, zoom using coord = coord_cartesian(ylim = ...). y_sec_axis secondary axis specified ggplot2::sec_axis ggplot2::dup_axis function. y_title Axis title string. Defaults converting sentence case spaces. Use "" title. y_trans numeric variable, transformation object (e.g. "log10"). col_breaks function takes limits input (e.g. scales::breaks_pretty()), vector breaks. col_continuous Type colouring continuous variable. Either "gradient" "steps". Defaults "steps". col_include numeric date variable, values scale include (e.g. 0). col_labels function takes breaks inputs (e.g. scales::label_comma()), vector labels. Note affect col_intervals NULL. col_legend_place place legend. "b" bottom, "r" right, "t" top, "l" left. Defaults "b". col_legend_ncol number columns legend elements. col_legend_nrow number rows legend elements. col_legend_rev Reverse elements legend. Defaults FALSE. col_limits vector determine limits axis. col_rescale continuous col variable, rescale position pal colour using scales::rescale function. col_title Legend title string. Defaults converting sentence case spaces. Use "" title. facet_labels function takes breaks inputs (e.g. scales::label_comma()), named vector labels (e.g. c("value" = "label", ...)). facet_ncol number columns facets. applies facet layout "wrap". facet_nrow number rows facets. applies facet layout "wrap". facet_scales Whether facet scales "fixed" across facets, "free" directions, free just one direction (.e. "free_x" "free_y"). Defaults "fixed". facet_space Whether facet_space "fixed" across facets, "free" proportional directions, free proportional just one direction (.e. "free_x" "free_y"). applies facet layout 'grid' facet_scales fixed. Defaults "fixed". facet_layout Whether layout "wrap" "grid". NULL single facet (facet2) argument provided, defaults "wrap". NULL facet facet2 arguments provided, defaults "grid".. caption Caption title string. theme ggplot2 theme.

title: ggblanket 1.4.0
text: CRAN release: 2022-09-02 Breaking: Removed col_intervals argument. Breaking: Removed *_oob argument. Breaking: gg_theme, changed *_style arguments *_face. Breaking: gg_theme, changed font arguments family. Added gg_polygon function. Added col_continuous argument support colouring “steps”. Added col_legend_rev argument reverse legends. Added facet_layout argument faceting flexibility. Added facet_space argument support proportional facet panels. Removed width default. Improved default legend look continuous gradient. Improved scales y NULL plot horizontal. Fixed bug position = "fill". Updated messages. Added vignette.

title: ggblanket 1.3.0
text: CRAN release: 2022-08-05 Breaking: removed facet_intervals argument. Breaking: made extensive changes gg_theme function. Added facet2 aesthetic support effortless grid facetting. Changed default background theme colours. Fixed bug *_limits *_include working correctly. Added *_sec_axis arguments. Changed *_oob default scales::oob_keep. Removed reversal logical variable order. Defaulted col_legend_place "b".

title: ggblanket 1.2.0
text: CRAN release: 2022-07-01 Breaking: Removed *_breaks_n *_breaks_width. Added support *_breaks receive function. Added *_include argument. Added *_trans argument. Modified default x_breaks behaviour x y numeric date. Enhanced gg_blank work one x y. Provided support ggplotly. Added new add_tooltip_text function. Added new titles argument apply function across titles. Support gg_ functions working stats. Removed size argument, anticipation ggplot2 3.4.0. Updated gg_theme title vjust margins.
